api_description: Returns a list of work items matching the request.

required_parameters.name: owned_by
required_parameters.description: Filters for work owned by any of these users

required_parameters.name: issue.priority
required_parameters.description: Filters for issues with any of the provided priorities. Allowed values: p0, p1, p2, p3

optional_parameters.name: created_by
optional_parameters.description: Filters for work created by any of these users

optional_parameters.name: applies_to_part
optional_parameters.description: Filters for work belonging to any of the provided parts

optional_parameters.name: issue.rev_orgs
optional_parameters.description: Filters for issues with any of the provided Rev organizations

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of works to return. The default is '50'

optional_parameters.name: stage.name
optional_parameters.description: Filters for records in the provided stage(s) by name

optional_parameters.name: ticket.needs_response
optional_parameters.description: Filters for tickets that need a response

optional_parameters.name: ticket.rev_org
optional_parameters.description: Filters for tickets associated with any of the provided Rev organizations

optional_parameters.name: ticket.severity
optional_parameters.description: Filters for tickets with any of the provided severities. Allowed values: blocker, high, low, medium

optional_parameters.name: ticket.source_channel
optional_parameters.description: Filters for tickets with any of the provided source channels

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Filters for work of the provided types. Allowed values: issue, ticket, task

api_descriptionn: Summarizes a list of objects. The object can be anything such as a issue, work item etc. The function returns a Human readable description of the given object. The logic of how to summarize a particular object type is an internal implementation detail.

api_description: Returns a list of objects sorted by priority. The logic of what constitutes priority for a given object is an internal implementation detail.

required_parameters.name: objects
required_parameters.description: A list of objects to be prioritized

api_description: Adds the given work items to the sprint

required_parameters.name: work_ids
required_parameters.description: A list of work item IDs to be added to the sprint.

required_parameters.name: sprint_id
required_parameters.description: The ID of the sprint to which the work items should be added

api_description: Returns the ID of the current sprint
Returns a list of work items/issues that are similar to the given work item/issue

required_parameters.name: work_id
required_parameters.description: The ID of the work item/issue for which you want to find similar items/issue

api_description: Given a search string, returns the id of a matching object in the system of record. If multiple matches are found, it returns the one where the confidence is highest.

required_parameters.name: query
required_parameters.description: The search string, could be for example customerâ€™s name, part name, user name.

api_description: Given a text, extracts actionable insights, and creates tasks for them, which are kind of a work item.

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.description: The text from which the actionable insights need to be created.

api_description: Returns the ID of the current user, also represented by 'my' in the prompts
